StringCharacterIterator(java.lang.String.Description: Constructs an iterator over the given range of the given string, with the index set at the specified position.

equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Compares the equality of two StringCharacterIterator objects.

Returns: the character at the new position or DONE if the current position is equal to getBeginIndex().

Parameters: String: The String to be iterated over
setText(java.lang.String).Description: Reset this iterator to point to a new string. This package-visible method is used by other java.text classes that want to avoid allocating new StringCharacterIterator objects every time their setText method is called.

Returns: the first character in the text, or DONE if the text is empty

Parameters: String: The String to be iterated over
StringCharacterIterator(java.lang.String.Description: Constructs an iterator with the specified initial index.

Returns: the character at the specified position or DONE if the specified position is equal to getEndIndex()
Parameters: int: the position within the text. Valid values range from getBeginIndex() to getEndIndex(). An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if an invalid value is supplied.

ClassDesc: StringCharacterIterator implements the CharacterIterator protocol for a String. The StringCharacterIterator class iterates over the entire String.
